headline.main: Times Minute | Reactions to Michael Sam

docs.snippet: With Michael Sam’s declaration that he is gay, there is no better moment than now to plow ahead and topple a wall of discrimination....
docs.lead_paragraph: With Michael Sam’s declaration that he is gay, there is no better moment than now to plow ahead and topple a wall of discrimination.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports Of The Times column welcomes Missouri defensive end Michael Sam's declaration that he is gay; holds that there is no better moment than now to plow ahead and topple wall of discrimination in professional sports, and for the NFL to grapple with the place of gays within its tough-guy image.

headline.main: It’s Time for the N.F.L. to Welcome a Gay Player
headline.print_headline: It’s Time for the N.F.L. to Welcome a Gay Player

docs.snippet: In a letter to the National Football League commissioner, Senator Maria Cantwell and Representative Tom Cole mentioned the league’s tax-exempt status....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a letter to the National Football League commissioner, Senator Maria Cantwell and Representative Tom Cole mentioned the league’s tax-exempt status.
docs.abstract: Sen Maria Cantwell and Rep Tom Cole plan to send a strongly worded letter to National Football League commissioner Roger Goodell urging him to support changing the name of the Washington Redskins; Cantwell says she may reconsider the league's tax-exempt status if it does not comply.

headline.main: Lawmakers Press N.F.L. on Name Change for Washington Redskins
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Press N.F.L. on Name of Redskins

docs.snippet: The all-American defensive end at the University of Missouri said he decided to come out publicly now because he sensed that rumors were circulating....
docs.lead_paragraph: The all-American defensive end at the University of Missouri said he decided to come out publicly now because he sensed that rumors were circulating.
docs.abstract: Michael Sam, all-American defensive end at the University of Missouri, publicly announces that he is gay; Sam, top NFL prospect, is now on course to become the first openly gay player in the league, reflecting accelerating pace of gay rights movement and opening door for other gay athletes to come forward.

headline.main: N.F.L. Prospect Michael Sam Proudly Says What Teammates Knew: He’s Gay
headline.print_headline: N.F.L. Prospect Proudly Says What Teammates Knew: He’s Gay

headline.main: First Lady: Gay Football Player Is 'Inspiration'
headline.print_headline: First Lady: Gay Football Player Is 'Inspiration'

docs.snippet: Football players at Northwestern University have kicked off a daunting, but not necessarily impossible, drive to become the first U.S. college athletes to unionize, starting a legal process with the potential to redefine college sports....

headline.main: Analysis: U.S. College Football Players Tackle NLRB in Bid to Unionize

docs.snippet: Two U.S. lawmakers on Monday rejected the National Football League's claim that the Washington Redskins name was an honor to Native Americans and urged the sports league to recognize it as a racial slur and back changing the name....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two U.S. lawmakers on Monday rejected the National Football League's claim that the Washington Redskins name was an honor to Native Americans and urged the sports league to recognize it as a racial slur and back changing the name.

headline.main: Lawmakers Call NFL on Redskins Name: It's an Insult, Not Honor
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Call NFL on Redskins Name: It's an Insult, Not Honor

docs.snippet: "There is a perception out there right now that the military is out of control. You are not going to attract the best and the brightest if people believe that if you go into the military you are going to be sexually assaulted." — K. Denise R...
docs.lead_paragraph: "There is a perception out there right now that the military is out of control. You are not going to attract the best and the brightest if people believe that if you go into the military you are going to be sexually assaulted." — K. Denise Rucker Krepp, a former Coast Guard officer and attorney, after an AP analysis found an inconsistent pattern of judgment in sex crimes cases out of U.S. bases in Japan.
